# Roleplay Rule 11-2 – Examples of Conflict Types
Conflict in Prospect Sector should stay **proportional**, **roleplay-driven**, and **non-disruptive** to station progression. These examples help clarify what actions fall under different levels of escalation.
## Verbal - Shouting - Yelling - Arguing or insulting (within RP boundaries)
## Non-harmful - Shoving - Light pranks - Stealing **non-critical, easily replaced items** (cups, pens, small tools)
## Non-lethal - Stealing items that inconvenience but do not endanger someone - Taking an ID in a location where the person is **not trapped or endangered** - Punching or simple fistfights - Using disablers or stuns in controlled RP situations - Detaining someone non-lethally during a dispute
## Lethal - Beating someone into crit or death (requires strong justification) - Attacking with dangerous tools or weapons (bats, spears, etc.) - Stealing items that place someone at **risk**, such as a hardsuit needed for safety - Taking an ID in a way that traps someone in a hazardous area
## Permanently lethal These are extreme actions and almost always unacceptable without admin approval: - Gibbing - Failing to get medical help for someone you critically injured (without strong RP reason) - Hiding bodies to prevent recovery - Spacing bodies or removing them from the round intentionally
